import Mathlib

open Matrix

/--
For 1 â‰¤ i â‰  j â‰¤ n and t âˆˆ â„, let E_{ij}(t) denote the elementary matrix obtained
from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. This matrix has determinant 1,
so it lies in SL(n, â„).
-/
theorem elementary_row_add_matrix_mem_SL (n : Nat) (i j : Fin n) (t : â„) (h : i â‰  j) :
  (1 + (fun a b => if a = i âˆ§ b = j then t else 0) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) â„) âˆˆ
    Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) â„ := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

/--
For 1 â‰¤ i â‰  j â‰¤ n and t âˆˆ â„, let E_{ij}(t) denote the elementary matrix obtained
from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. This matrix has determinant 1,
so it lies in SL(n, â„).
-/
theorem elementary_row_add_matrix_mem_SL (n : Nat) (i j : Fin n) (t : â„) (h : i â‰  j) :
  Matrix.det ((1 : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) â„) + Matrix.of (fun a b => if a = i âˆ§ b = j then t else 0)) = 1 := by
  sorry
